definitions.body: Jeroboam, Ieroboam (prob. = [[יָרׂב]] + [[עַם]] the people increaseth Thes Kit:1Ki 11:26 al.; cf. also Gray:prop.N. 59; Ency. Bib. i. 139 f.; > √ [[ריב]] the people contendeth or (the god) ‘Amm contendeth Nbr:Stud. Bib. i. 225, cf. Che:JQ. July, 1899, 559; Ency. Bib.);—

:90 (K Ch), leader of revolt of N. Isr. (10th cent.), and first king 1Ki 11:26, 1Ki 12:2, 1Ki 12:2, 1Ki 12:20, etc., ‖ 2Ch 10:2, 2Ch 10:2, 2Ch 10:3, 2Ch 10:12 etc., 1Ki 13:1, 1Ki 13:4, 1Ki 13:33 + ; (specif. [[בֶּן־נְבָט]] ´[[יר]]: 1Ki 11:26 + 23 t.); in later times (uner Deut. Infl.) as sinful and author of Isr.’s sin 1Ki 15:30, 1Ki 16:2, 1Ki 16:7, 1Ki 16:19, 1Ki 16:26, 1Ki 16:31 + 15 t. †

son of Jehoash of N. Isr. (8th cent.) and 13th king 2Ki 13:13, 2Ki 14:16, 2Ki 14:23, 2Ki 14:27, 2Ki 14:28, 2Ki 14:29, 2Ki 15:1, 2Ki 15:8, Ho 1:1, Am 1:1, Am 7:9, Am 7:10, Am 7:11; prob. also 1Ch 5:17.
